critique:
This document is an executive order transferring jurisdiction over the construction of the United States Capitol wings from the Department of the Interior to the War Department. It expresses a belief that the public interest will be promoted by having a skilled officer from the Corps of Engineers or Topographical Corps oversee the work, as these officers are more directly accountable to the Secretary of War. The order requests the Secretary of War to designate a suitable officer to take charge of the project.

Ideological Tilt: 0. This document does not express any clear ideological leaning. It is a matter of administrative organization.
Immigration Approach: 0. This document has nothing to do with immigration.
Executive Power: 0. The document transfers power from one department to another, but it does not expand the power of the executive branch as a whole.
Federalism: 0. The document does not significantly alter the balance of power between the federal government and the states.
National Security vs. Civil Liberties: 0. This document does not touch upon national security or civil liberties.
Economic Regulation: 0. This document has no impact on economic regulation.
Social Inclusion: 0. This document does not address social inclusion or diversity.
